summary: Expand the “everything tracker” to include bi-directional Tasks↔Calendar syncing for dated items, recurring Calendar entries (weekly/monthly/yearly), a modernized top menu bar branded as “The Everything Tracker” with a city/desk background image, an enhanced Crypto page with profit/loss summaries, and a new Dashboard market summary showing top prices across crypto, stocks, and commodities—alongside existing Budget/Calendar/Tasks improvements and Crypto price-pull work.
architectural_notes: Privacy/security requirement: safeguard all user entry information using SHA-256 per app silo to prevent information collection on the individual.
Add UI-level session security state detection to drive a persistent privacy indicator (secure vs insecure session) without exposing sensitive data.
Adopt a mobile-first design system with Settings-style toggle components and allow per-section theming (e.g., Crypto/To-Do).
Add seeded/example content per section (2–3 examples) that is clearly marked as sample data and does not compromise privacy.
Crypto section scope change: allow external API integration for fetching current prices (replace prior no-external-API stance), with attention to privacy and minimal data sharing.

Scope expansion: support external price/quote integrations not only for crypto but also for stocks and commodities to power the dashboard market summary and P/L calculations, with privacy-first/minimal data sharing.
known_issues: App reported as “no longer loading” (needs investigation/regression fix).
Crypto entry bug: entering 1 unit of BTC becomes 10,000,000 automatically (likely unit/decimal scaling or formatting issue).
Budget entries add additional zeros to the user’s entered values (likely formatting/scaling).
Budget tab summary at the top is not reflective of user entries.

existing_features.title: Create a central dashboard page that lets a signed-in user choose between Tasks, Goals, Calendar, and Budget sections of the app.
Implement Tasks management for each signed-in user: create, list, update, complete/uncomplete, and delete tasks.
Implement Goals tracking for each signed-in user: create, list, update, and delete goals, including optional target date and progress/status.
Implement Calendar tracking for each signed-in user: create, list, update, and delete calendar entries (events/reminders) with date/time support.
Implement Budget tracking for each signed-in user: create, list, update, and delete income/expense items and show basic summaries (e.g., totals by month and net total).

Safeguard user-entered information using SHA-256 per app silo: for every stored user entry (task, goal, calendar item, budget item), compute and store a SHA-256 digest using a per-user/per-silo salt so the backend can store and return integrity-checked data without exposing raw content through logging/debug or cross-user access.
Define and apply a coherent visual theme across the app (layout, typography, spacing, and component styling) appropriate for a personal productivity organizer.
Add generated static image assets (logo + section icons) to the frontend and render them in the UI (dashboard + header).
Update the Dashboard page (frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx) to include richer, at-a-glance summaries for Tasks, Goals, Calendar, and Budget in addition to the existing navigation cards.

Add toggle controls on the dashboard that let the user switch what summaries are shown (e.g., show/hide each section’s summary and/or toggle between summary modes such as 'Stats' vs 'Recent' per section).

Wire the dashboard summaries to the existing React Query data sources by fetching the signed-in user’s tasks, goals, calendar entries, and budget items using the existing hooks, and compute summary values client-side for display on the dashboard.

Fix the regression where the app is "no longer loading" by identifying and resolving the runtime/build error(s) so the initial route renders successfully and navigation to existing sections (Dashboard, Tasks, Goals, Calendar, Budget) works without a blank screen or crash.

Add a persistent "privacy confirmed" live status indicator bar with a video game themed look that is purple when the user is securely logged in, and flashes/turns red when the session is not secure (e.g., user is not authenticated).

Redesign the global UI theme to a mobile-first “everything tracker” experience that feels fun, helpful, and easy to use, with Apple Settings–style toggle boxes/panels for preferences and settings-like controls across the app.

Make security/encryption visibility explicit in the UI by adding clear, friendly copy near data entry areas indicating that entries are protected with encryption/integrity safeguards, without claiming any third-party certification or external security service.

Provide 2–3 in-app example entries/templates in each organizer section (Tasks, Goals, Calendar, Budget, and Crypto) to guide users on what information best pertains to each area, shown as examples when the user has no items yet and/or as quick-add suggestions.

Add a new "Crypto" section to the app, including navigation access, a dedicated page, and basic per-user CRUD tracking for crypto entries, with a UI theme resembling Coinbase (visual style only; no external API integration).

Apply per-section theming so that the Tasks (to-do list) section resembles a sports-related / paper scroll / private theme, while still matching the app’s overall mobile-first tracker design and not harming readability.
Integrate live crypto price pulls in the Crypto section so the user does not need to manually enter a current price when adding or editing a crypto position.

Fix the Crypto amount/unit bug where entering 1 unit of BTC is displayed or treated as 10,000,000 (or otherwise incorrectly scaled), ensuring amounts entered in the UI round-trip correctly and calculations reflect the intended units.

Remove the Dashboard “Summary Settings” settings-card box and replace it with a compact dropdown control that allows the same summary configuration (enable/disable sections and select Stats/Recent modes).

Fix the Budget amount “extra zeros” issue by making Budget item amounts round-trip correctly between (1) user-entered decimal dollars in the form, (2) stored integer cents in the backend, and (3) displayed currency values in the Budget table and edit dialog.

Fix the Budget tab top summary so it accurately reflects the user’s budget entries by ensuring summary computations and the displayed transaction amounts use the same cents-to-dollars scaling, and provide a clear summary period that matches what users expect when viewing the full transaction list.

Update the Calendar tab to render a user-selectable calendar layout with three options: Full year view, Monthly view, and Weekly view; persist the user’s selected view locally so it remains consistent when returning to the Calendar tab.
Add a visible per-day scheduled indicator symbol on all Calendar breakout options (year/month/week) so days with at least one calendar entry are visibly marked in the grid.

Update the Tasks tab to display tasks in three sections: (1) Day-of-the-week tasks, (2) Recurring daily tasks, and (3) Weekend tasks, and add UI controls in the task create/edit flow to assign a task to one of these sections.

Implement bi-directional syncing between Tasks and Calendar for dated items so that (a) any Task with a due date appears in the Calendar, and (b) Calendar items created as dated tasks appear in the Tasks list, with updates/deletes kept consistent across both.
Add support for recurring Calendar entries with user-selectable recurrence options: weekly, monthly, and yearly, exposed as a checkbox/toggle control in the Calendar entry create/edit flow.
Add a new Dashboard “market summary” section that shows the top 10 Crypto, Stocks, and Commodities prices, and display it on the dashboard page.

Modernize the top menu/header UI to include a large branded title “The Everything Tracker” and a hero-style background image depicting a very organized city as seen from an organized desk space overlooking the city.

Enhance the Crypto page to include: (1) a total portfolio profit/loss summary computed from the user’s entries using live/current price vs purchase price, and (2) a per-asset profit/loss status listing that replaces the current “Unique Assets” stat concept in the summary.

Update the Calendar entry creation/editing UI to allow users to choose whether a new calendar entry is a Task or an Event, so that calendar-created tasks participate in Tasks↔Calendar sync while calendar-created events remain calendar-only.
